Legal_Issue: Whether the plaintiff's statement of claim discloses a reasonable cause of action in negligence
Evidence_Assessment: Plaintiff's claim found vague and lacking factual specificity
Decision_Outcome: Statement of claim struck out without leave to amend
Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiff to establish all elements of negligence
Legal_Rule: To establish negligence, the plaintiff must plead: (1) damage, (2) causation, (3) breach of standard of care, (4) duty of care, (5) proximate cause, and (6) absence of contributory negligence
Standard_of_Review: Judicial review of pleadings on a generous basis
Procedural_Issue: Failure to disclose a reasonable cause of action
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged negligence by defendant causing damage
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to failure to meet legal requirements
Review_Standard: Whether the pleading discloses a reasonable cause of action
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court applied generous interpretation but found pleading fundamentally deficient
Key_Evidence_Considered: The statement of claim as filed by the plaintiff
Legal_Framework: Tort law, rules of civil procedure
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiff failed to meet procedural and substantive pleading standards
Court_Result: Dismissal of claim as frivolous, vexatious, and beyond amendment
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities (implied for civil negligence)
Defendant_Response: Motion to strike out the claim for failure to disclose a cause of action
Legal_Provision: Rules of civil procedure regarding pleading sufficiency
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Vagueness, lack of factual basis, failure to plead essential elements of negligence
Applicable_Process: Motion to strike out under civil procedure rules
Governing_Rule: Doctrine of negligence and pleading standards in civil litigation
